summary: Judith R Burford was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She appears on payroll certifications for the committee in October and November 1977, and May 1978. The documents list her name, position, and salary, indicating she was a staff member during the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination.
